alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Maryland Beaches; Somerset (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 10 at 5:54AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...GUSTY SHOWERS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN SOMERSET...SOUTHERN WORCESTER...ACCOMACK...SOUTHEASTERN MIDDLESEX...SOUTHEASTERN NORTHUMBERLAND...ISLE OF WIGHT...NORTHEASTERN SOUTHAMPTON...YORK... EASTERN JAMES CITY...GLOUCESTER...NORTHAMPTON...MATHEWS...EASTERN SURRY AND LANCASTER COUNTIES...THE CITY OF POQUOSON...THE CITY OF NORFOLK...THE CITY OF CHESAPEAKE...THE CITY OF HAMPTON...THE CITY OF NEWPORT NEWS...THE CITY OF FRANKLIN...THE CITY OF PORTSMOUTH...THE CITY OF SUFFOLK...THE CITY OF VIRGINIA BEACH AND THE CITY OF WILLIAMSBURG THROUGH 645 AM EST... At 554 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from near Tangier to near Windsor. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Newport News, Hampton, Smithfield, Christopher Newport University, Langley AFB, Patrick Henry Field, Seaford, Suffolk, Northampton, and Tangier around 600 AM EST. Hampton University around 605 AM EST. Churchland, Norfolk, Portsmouth, Grand View, Fort Monroe, and Buckroe Beach around 610 AM EST. Exmore, Cape Charles, Old Dominion University, Ocean View, Onancock, Parksley, Onley, Nassawadox, and Norfolk NAS around 615 AM EST. Virginia Beach, Cheriton, Ghent, Willis Wharf, Norview, and Bay View around 620 AM EST. Norfolk International around 625 AM EST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Pons, Carrollton, Portlock, Laban, Camp Peary, Oriana, Huntersville, Brook Vale, Sanford, and Poolesville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
